results.title: Up, down, all around: math readiness
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series ” Math readiness”
Uses a story about a lion and his troubles in building his house in order to illustrate the characteristics of directiional relationships.
Suitable for lower and middle primary level.

group_siblings.title: This one with that one: math readiness

results.title: This one with that one: math readiness
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Math readiness”
Uses a story about a fisherman who cannot decide how to match his lines, baits and fish, in order to illustrate the concept of one-to-one matching.
Suitable for lower and middle primary levels.

results.title: Ansel Adams
results.brief_description:
Episode number 6 of Series “Master Photographers Series”.
America’s most distinguished landscape photographer, Ansel Adams also has a reputation as one of the world’s greatest printers of photographs.

results.title: Andre Kertesz
results.brief_description:
Episode number 5 of Series “Master Photographers Series”.
Hungarian born Kertesz is considered the poet amongst photographers. In this film Kertesz talks explicitly about the influences on his work, his early life in Hungary, Paris in the 20’s, his colleagues and his friends, Chagall, Mondrian and Colette, and his bitter and long battle for acceptance in the United States.

results.brief_description:

results.title: Andreas Feininger
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Master Photographers Series”.
A fascinating look at the technical possibilities of creative photography and at Feininger’s firm belief that the camera can enrich people’s way of seeing.

results.title: Bill Brandt
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Master Photographers Series”.
In this rare insight, Brandt shows some of his favourite photographs among them pictures of Paris in the 1920s, his compassionate scenes of Britain in the Depression, his Nudes and many distinguished portraits.

results.title: Alfred Eisenstaedt
results.creator_credit: Peter Adam and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Master Photographers Series”.
Looks at the life and work of former ‘Life’ magazine photographer Alfred Eisenstaedt. Concentrates on portraits of celebrities from 1929 to the present.
